subject: Leadership
title: Asking Powerful Questions
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Asking Powerful Questions.

hook.text: A team is stuck. The leader doesn't give answers. She asks one question: 'What would we do if we couldn't fail?'

buildup.text: Questions shape thinking. Closed questions get yes or no. Open questions unlock creativity, reflection, and ownership.

discovery.text: Socrates never lectured. He asked questions until students found answers themselves. The method works 2,400 years later.

twist.text: Most leaders ask leading questions that confirm their own views. Truly powerful questions challenge assumptions.

climax.text: Start questions with 'what' or 'how' instead of 'why.' It invites exploration rather than defensiveness.

punchline.text: A good answer closes one door. A good question opens ten.

quiz.question: Why are 'what' and 'how' questions more effective than 'why' questions?
options: They invite exploration instead of defensiveness
